turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bestrophin-2.
turn.2: Bestrophin-2 Bestrophin-2 is a protein that in humans is encoded by the "BEST2" gene.
turn.3: What channel is the protein a part of?
turn.4: This gene is a member of the bestrophin gene family of anion channels.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Bestrophin genes share a similar gene structure with highly conserved exon-intron boundaries, but with distinct 3' ends.
turn.8: Bestrophins are transmembrane proteins that contain a homologous region rich in aromatic residues, including an invariant arg-phe-pro motif.
turn.9: Do any of the family members cause diseases?
turn.10: Mutation in one of the family members (bestrophin 1) is associated with vitelliform macular dystrophy.
turn.12: The bestrophin 2 gene is mainly expressed in the non-pigmented ciliary epithelium and colon.
